dict.string: How does the schedule operate?
The schedule has 2 modes of operate: manual or automatic. Automatic causes the days to advance with each new day. Manual mode requires that you advance the day.
How do I setup a schedule?
First you need to have setup all the events that you want to include in the exercise schedule. Then using setup section you create a schedule.
What does Schedule Repeat count do?

Schedule Repeat count is use to define the number of times the complete schedule will be repeated. For example: setting the number of weeks to 3 and the repeat count to 4 would result in the schedule repeating 4 time for a total of 12 weeks.
Can I setup my own exercise event?
Yes.
Is the data stored on the cloud?
No, maybe in a future release.
Can I edii recorded data?
Yes. Select the bootom button labeled 'Edit Data'. You can then edit all recorded events and schedules.
Can I edit event setup data?
Yes. Select the bottom button labed 'Edit Data', then selected the desired event. The first item listed in the table is the event setup data.
What is the event setup data?

The event setup data enables you to define starting parameters for the event. For ex: 50 lbs and 8 reps. Then when you select the event the starting parameters will be automatically configured as your starting point.
Why is the weight amount automatically being set to the last amount?
The first recorded weight amount is always used as the starting amount for the next workout.
What can I see in history?
Can see a list sorted by date of the recorded events. Selecting the Chart button will display a graph of the recorded data.
How does the history chart work?
The history chart contains buttons that enable you to select the parameter (if applicable) and a time period.
